column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: South Carolina

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Only right turns are allowed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 2. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 3. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Reduced visibility.
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 4. Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your blind spots and, mirrors.
column6: signal your intention before changing lanes.

column2: 5. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Young people.

column2: 6. Headlights must be turned on:
column4: from 6 AM to 6 PM.

column2: 7. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 8. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 9. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 10. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective yellow diamond

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 12. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column6: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.
column8: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.

column2: 13. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 14. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 15. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: maximum speed

column2: 16. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 17. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 18. On a multi-lane highway, you approach a school bus coming from the other direction that is stopped and has its red lights flashing. You:
column4: May pass because you are not required to stop.
column6: Must put on your emergency flashers.

column2: 19. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 20. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: green; white

column2: 21. When driving in fog, you should:
column4: use your emergency flashers to warn other drivers.
column6: slow down and use your low beams.
column8: slow down and use your high beams.

column2: 22. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: the first rain after a dry spell.

column2: 23. A flashing red light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 24. Drivers who refuse to submit to a chemical test for alcohol or drugs will have their license suspended for:
column4: 60 days.

column2: 25. All temporary signs in work zones have an orange background and white letters or symbols.
column4: False

column2: 26. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road ahead is narrow.
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 27. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the crosswalk.

column2: 28. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: when a child is about to run into the street.
column6: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.

column2: 29. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
column4: on high-speed highways.

column2: 30. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
